Job Title: Postdoctoral Position In Computational Psychiatry (Real-World Applications of AI and Machine Learning on Health Data)
Job Description:
Department Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry - Psychiatry Dept
Hours per week -
Posted date May 17, 2024
Closing date Will remain open until filled.
Position Type Full Time
Description
The positions are available immediately and funding is sufficient to support the initial position for at least two years. The stipend will be commensurate with the experience of the successful candidate.
This position offers a benefits package found at Postdoctoral Fellows Benefits.
Department Summary
The Department of Psychiatry at the University of Alberta in Edmonton is recruiting two postdoctoral fellows in computational psychiatry focusing on Real-World Applications of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) on Health Data (e.g., claims, prescriptions, emergency visits, hospitalization records, laboratory tests, clinical, behavioral and cognitive assessments, surveys).
The aim of the projects is to improve health outcomes and facilitate evidence-based decision making about mental and substance use disorders and other adverse outcomes (e.g., overdose) for clinicians, health service providers and policymakers through the translation and implementation of AI and ML in the real world beyond research settings.
The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Metis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.
The Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry at the University of Alberta is one of Canada’s premiere health-sciences institutes, and in recent years has ranked among the top 50 medical schools in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. The University of Alberta is home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, more than 300,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada's Greenest Employers for over a decade.
The University of Alberta is located in Edmonton, a vibrant metropolitan area of 1.5M and the provincial capital for Alberta. This friendly city offers a rich cultural life and diverse recreational opportunities. The campus on which the Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry is located is adjacent to the North Saskatchewan River with one of the largest municipal park systems in North America. Edmonton is approximately 3.5 hours by car from Jasper and from Banff in the Canadian Rockies.
Position Summary
The successful applicants will participate and lead research that applies advanced statistical, AI and ML techniques to large populational health data of patients with mental and substance use disorders. Current and potential projects include two main directions: 1) Individualized prediction of mental and substance use disorders and overdoses and associated health and economical outcomes in the population using health, survey and biological data; 2) Implementation of ML models through interactions with multiple stakeholders and people with living and lived experiences.
The successful applicants will have the opportunity of supervised access to several public and government/institution owned datasets, including large (over 4 million people) de-identified health data from Alberta. In this context, there are excellent opportunities for shared mentorship and collaboration with several PIs in psychiatry and computing science, including the Alberta machine intelligence institute (Amii).
The successful applicants will play a leadership role for several research projects in computational psychiatry, develop and participate in preparation of research grant proposals, assist in the supervision and training of other personnel including technologists, graduate students, other lab members and scientific collaborators. The successful applicant will also have the opportunity to work directly with our partners in Ministries of Alberta Government, Alberta Health Services (AHS) and Canadian Mental Health Association Edmonton, as well as international partners. The ideal applicant will exhibit a high level of motivation to pursue data-driven research in mental disorders, to publish in excellent peer-reviewed journals, and to seek prestigious fellowships and research awards, as appropriate.
Qualifications
Applicants must possess a doctoral degree (PhD or MD/PhD) in relevant disciplines, such as computer science, mathematics, neuroscience, physics, psychiatry, psychology or statistics.
Clinical or health research experience and strong coding or analytical skills are required.
Fluency in English is a requirement and for applicants who did not complete training in an accredited English language institution, IELTS scores will normally be required as evidence of proficiency.
Previous experience in structured and/or unstructured large-scale health data, a vision in future precision and personalized mental health, strong scientific writing and communication skills and capability to work collaboratively in an interdisciplinary team and dynamic environment are desired.
To :
Candidates should submit a cover letter, a statement of career goals, research interests (e.g., preferred research direction) and vision for research track if applicable; a complete CV (Canadian Common CV is acceptable) including a summary of graduate thesis research and post-doctoral research (if applicable), undergraduate and graduate transcripts, and the names and contact information (address, phone number and email address) of three referees to:
Dr. Bo Cao
Associate Professor, Canada Research Chair & Co-Director of Computational Psychiatry Group
Department of Psychiatry, Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry
Adjunct Professor, Department of Computing Science, Faculty of Science
University of Alberta
Edmonton, Alberta T6G 2B7, Canada
Email address: bcao2@ualberta.ca
Webpage: https://www.ualberta.ca/medicine/about/people/Bo-Cao

Alberta Newsprint Company (ANC), a joint venture of the Stern Group and West Fraser Timber Company Ltd., is a leading manufacturer of premium paper products. Located in Whitecourt, and operating with a non-unionized workforce, the firm’s paper mill—the first in Alberta—produces paper of such high quality that it has become the standard by which other paper products manufactured in North America are measured. The company is a successful, well-financed, progressive organization that is regarded as one of the best companies in the paper industry.

ANC is currently recruiting for a full-time, permanent Process Control Engineer role. Reporting to the Automation, Technology and Systems Manager, as part of our systems department, this position actively analyzes, identifies, and designs process improvements to improve the quality, efficiency, yield, and safety of ANC’s paper manufacturing process.

The right candidate is a technical expert who is comfortable managing between ideas and actualities, and skilled at leading that process.


RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES

Provide support or take a leading role in the following areas and corresponding activities:

Process Control and Operations:

Basic and Advanced Process Control Strategies.
Control Loop Performance and Tuning, including Key Performance Indicator.
Identification of Control Optimization Opportunities.
Power Plant Cost Reduction/Efficiency.
Operations and Production Support.

Design Documentation:

Control Narratives / Cause and Effect Diagrams.
Control System Network Architecture.
SmartPlant Instrumentation/Electrical
HMI Configuration Standard.
Control System Configuration Standard.
Alarm Philosophy.
P&C diagrams.

Control Systems and Configuration:

System Heath Status, Diagnostics and Troubleshooting.
Implementation of IoT Practices.
Control Process Networking Planning and Deployment.
Support App/Scripting Development.
Cybersecurity Planning.
Consistent implementation of Logic and HMI standard.

Project:

User Requirement Documentation.
Lead new technology implementation.
Control System Upgrade and Mill areas modernization.
New Initiatives Crew Presentation.
Management of Change.
Participation in Technical Reviews.

On-going support:

Establish Work practices.
Process Control System troubleshooting.
Foster a teamwork environment and encourage continuous communication with Operations.
E&I Technician Support/Skills Development.
Become adept to the Company policies/procedures and Regulatory standards to provide adequate support whenever electrical / instrumentation or process control design changes are made in the mill.
Meet regularly with E&I team members and operations to identify opportunities where support can be provided.
Participate in the On-Call support program.


QUALIFICATIONS

Engineering Degree specialized in Process Control.
APEGA Membership as a P.Eng. or eligible.
Must have a safety-focused mindset and strong knowledge of safe work practices.
Have a sense of responsibility, accountability, and ownership of your work. Be a self-starter and self-motivated to complete tasks and meet deadlines.
5+ years’ experience in process industry (pulp and paper experience is an asset).
In depth knowledge of Advanced Process Control Strategies and loop tuning methods.
Realtime optimization, Artificial Intelligent and/or Machine Learning are definitively assets.
Experienced on Alarm Management Cycle, High Performance and Abnormal Situation Management Operator Displays.
Knowledge of OT/IT Manufacturing Best Practices and Industrial Automation Cybersecurity.
Knowledge on Industrial Communication Protocols (Modbus TCP, ProfiBus, Profinet)
Historian integration/configuration (MOPS, DataPark, OSI PI), computer virtualization and TCP/IP networking is an asset.
Highly experienced in DCS and PLC configurations, preferred but not limited to ABB 800xA/AC800M, Bailey Symphony Plus and Siemens PLCs platforms.
Adept to Project Management Cycle in a multifunctional environment.
Strong foundation in Control System documentation; Control Narratives, PFD, P&IDs, Cause and Effects Diagrams, User Requirement/Functional Design/Detailed Design Specifications.
Demonstrated skills in legacy and modern programming languages (Visual Basic, Python, SQL, etc.) and/or data analytics and visualization tools is beneficial.
Team player, open to transfer knowledge, with a mentoring mindset, innovative thinking,


Alberta Newsprint Company will only consider those eligible to work in Canada either by citizenship, permanent residency, or valid Canadian open work permit.
We thank all those who apply, but only applicants being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

“This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge AI research in Trust and Safety — driving innovation, building trust, and enabling adoption of AI. You’ll collaborate with leading researchers and practitioners to turn breakthroughs into real-world impact. There’s so much meaningful work ahead and we’re eager to build it together.”
Alyssa Lefaivre Škopac | Director, AI Trust and Safety
About Amii

One of Canada’s three main institutes for artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning, our world-renowned researchers drive fundamental and applied research at the University of Alberta (and other academic institutions), training some of the world’s top scientific talent. Our cross-functional teams work collaboratively with Alberta-based businesses and organizations to build AI capacity and translate scientific advancement into industry adoption and economic impact.
About the Role

Reporting to the Director of AI Trust and Safety, the Applied Research Scientist will lead innovative research on AI Trust and Safety, with a focus on advanced AI systems and systemic societal risks. They will contribute to shaping an agile research agenda that aligns with Amii’s strengths, addresses key gaps in the trust and safety landscape, and aligns with priority research areas identified by the Canadian AI Safety Institute (CAISI).

The Applied Research Scientist will leverage research outputs—such as academic papers, whitepapers, conference presentations, and practical tools—to establish Amii as a thought leader in AI safety. Their work will advance understanding of AI risks, drive the development of more trustworthy AI systems, and support responsible AI adoption.

The position focuses on achieving excellence in three main accountabilities:

Trust and Safety AI Research Projects: Define and validate all projects in the Trust and Safety research portfolio.
Leadership & Strategy: Provide scientific thought leadership across industry and ML domains.
Project Execution: Ensure successful implementation and delivery on our most ambitious Trust and Safety projects.

Required Skills / Expertise

Key Responsibilities:

Trust and Safety Research Projects

Develops and proposes detailed proposals for T&S Research projects, including objectives, scope, methodologies, and resource requirements
Conducts thorough validation of project feasibility, assessing technical requirements, potential risks, and alignment with organizational goals
Regularly reviews and updates project plans to adapt to new insights, technologies, or shifts in industry trends
Connects existing research, leveraging insights to drive new project development
Writes and publishes scientific and white papers
Develops algorithms and tools to work on real-world systems and simulations
Analyzes and leverages research data in T&S in both structured and unstructured environments
Finds opportunities for collaboration with either research institutions and projects in Canada and internationally


Leadership & Strategy

Stays current with advancements in AI, ML and T&S, offering cutting-edge insights and guidance
Guides additional team members, including ML Engineers, Applied Scientists, post-docs etc. in the T&S portfolio
Supports, multi-stakeholder discussions to establish the technical and strategic direction for T&S projects
Mentors and provides strategic advice on complex T&S projects
Develops and communicates a clear vision and strategy for T&S at Amii
Represents the organization at conferences, workshops, and industry events, sharing knowledge and building a reputation as a thought leader in AI T&S
Supports with reporting requirements and generating insights on our trust and safety impact for key funding and government bodies


Project Execution

Oversees the successful implementation of high-impact T&S research projects
Manages cross-functional teams, coordinates project timelines, and resolves challenges to ensure project success
Evaluates project results to assess performance and determine whether to continue, pivot, or discontinue research projects
Provides technical guidance and support to junior team members

Qualifications:

Ph.D. in Machine Learning or related field with relevant experience in Machine Learning
5+ years of experience developing, training and evaluating machine learning models in an applied setting, including a solid publication record
Experience or interest in the trust and safety research landscapes and areas of research focus
Proficient in Python, experience in other programming languages i.e. Java or SQL (nice to have)
Proficient with machine learning tools and frameworks such as Scikit-learn, Pytorch/Tensorflow, Pandas, Optuna, Wandb, lightgbm/XGBoost, and SciPy
Expert understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of a range of ML techniques across supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning
Foundational and current knowledge of cutting-edge advancements in ML/AI
Ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly to non-technical audiences

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Demonstrates presence, self-confidence, sound judgment, and superior problem-solving ability
Strong interpersonal communication skills for effective interactions with internal departments and external stakeholders
A motivated leader who demonstrates individual drive and an uncompromising desire to achieve exceptional results
Promotes high-level cross-functional collaboration and establishes credibility while influencing peers to achieve common goals
Demonstrates professional maturity, resourcefulness and self-discipline in engaging in the pursuit of the organization’s goals
Able to work independently and make informed decisions while collaborating with staff and subject matter experts
Active participation in the research community: publishing research, serving as research reviewers, supporting Amii students, speaking or teaching within their area of expertise

What you'll love about us

A professional yet casual work environment that encourages the growth and development of your skills
Participate in professional development activities
Gain access to the Amii community and events
A chance to learn from amazing teammates who support one another to succeed
Competitive compensation, including paid time off and flexible health benefits
A modern office located in downtown Edmonton, Alberta

How to Apply

If this sounds like the opportunity you've been waiting for, please don’t wait to apply - we’re excited to add a new member to the Amii team for this position. We are keeping the door open to new applicants until we find the right fit. When sending your application, please send your resume and cover letter indicating why you think you'd be a fit for Amii. In your cover letter, please include one professional accomplishment you are most proud of and why.
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the time of application.
Amii is an equal opportunity employer and values a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to ethnicity, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age or disability. Accommodations for disability-related needs throughout the recruitment and selection process are available upon request. Any information provided by you for accommodations will be kept confidential and won’t be used in the selection process.

OpsGuru, a Carbon60 Company, is a global engineering and consulting group specializing in data, machine learning/artificial intelligence, and cloud-native technologies. We empower customers by leveraging technology to solve their unique business challenges, guiding them toward successful digital transformation.
Our value to clients lies in our ability to provide deep technical guidance aligned with real business needs. Principal Data Architects play a critical role in this, bringing a high level of expertise in Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning, including Data Governance and Compliance. These architects combine technical depth with business acumen, enabling them to confidently engage stakeholders at all levels—from engineers to the C-suite—throughout the entire technology adoption lifecycle.
Principal Data Architects are assigned to multiple strategic accounts, where they act as trusted technical advisors. They are respected thought leaders who challenge and guide clients in a collaborative, respectful manner to ensure maximum value from their technology investments.
In addition to their client-facing responsibilities, Principal Architects actively contribute to the sales process—often in a pre-sales or subject matter expert (SME) capacity. They partner with Account Executives and Presales Architects to scope opportunities, define technical solutions, and help craft detailed statements of work. Their involvement in ongoing account management is essential to sustaining long-term client success.
Principal Architects may also take on leadership responsibilities, dedicating approximately 10% of their time to mentoring, supporting, and developing a team of architects and engineers as people managers.
What you'll be doing:
Principal Data Architects are expected to provide deep business and technical expertise across Data Analytics, Data Processing, Data Governance & AI & ML areas, as part of the role you will:

Report directly to OpsGuru Engineering Leadership.
Confidently discuss every stage of the technology adoption cycle all the way from the CEO to the developer, across multiple technical domains.
Assigned to a number of accounts and are expected to work with their clients to become a trusted technical advisor.
Thought leadership.
Contribute to internal and external evangelism by creating and sharing content such as blog posts, whitepapers, and case studies that highlight best practices and success stories
Represent OpsGuru at conferences and industry events as a speaker, panelist, or subject matter expert, as appropriate
Guide and challenge clients in a respectful manner to ensure they receive the highest level of value from their technology investments.
Provide oversight to project teams to ensure technical outcomes align to solving customer business problems within project budgets and timelines
Work with Engagement Managers to help manage project scope, and work with project teams and customers to help manage project expectations and delivery quality
Comfortably discuss budget considerations and ROI with stakeholders, ensuring clients understand how recommended technologies align with financial and strategic goals
Participate in the sales process, typically in a pre-sales or equivalent capacity.
Work alongside our Account Executives and Presales Architects to scope and provide support on creating statements of works for our clients, as well as being heavily involved in account management.


While this role is largely focused around technical and consulting based delivery directly with customers, the Principal Data Architect may also be required to act as a people manager for a team of several direct reports of Architects and Engineers.

This would include tasks such as having regular one-to-one meetings, having professional development and goal setting conversations, and acting as part of a communication and feedback system with your direct team. Additionally you would help to escalate administrative or project related issues brought to your attention, and provide recommendations towards performance reviews and promotions for your team.
Your skills & experience:

Technical and Consulting:
The ideal candidate applying for the Principal Data Architect Role has the following:
10+ years of experience in a relevant Information Technology environment
7+ years of experience delivering Professional Services on major cloud providers (Amazon Web Services - must, Google Cloud or Microsoft Azure - nice to have) focusing on the following programs (3 minimum):
Large Scale workload migrations (on prem to cloud, cloud to cloud)
Data Platform modernisation
Modern, large scale Lakehouse Implementations
Data Security, Governance and Compliance
Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence Implementations
Technological Exposure:
Previous hands on experience with AWS (Must) , Azure / Google Cloud (Nice to have)
Python for Data Analytics
Relational databases design, tuning and migration
Experience with Enterprise Data Warehouses
Data Lakes, Data Pipelines and ETL’s
Stream & Batch Processing with frameworks like Spark
Data modeling for both transactional and analytics
BI Dashboards & Data Visualizations
Data Quality gates, Data Lineage, Data Catalogue
Exposure to Machine Learning and MLOps Frameworks (ex: Sagemaker)
Exposure to Generative AI and foundational models
A history of delivering presentations to a wide ranging audience including CxO,VP, Director level executives
A history of managing multiple complex projects with a wide variety of stakeholders, simultaneously
Technical Pre-Sales experience with the ability to provide strong SME guidance in customer-facing sales and presales conversations.
Able to confidently model costs and explain the total cost of ownership model of a proposed solution.
A history of holding a budget and is able to model project costs and provide resourcing plans
A history of handling customer requests and escalations and is able to confidently resolve challenges on projects effectively and swiftly.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


People Management:
Ability to adapt your communication style to individual team members
Be an ambassador for the company by being able to explain our business value to customers, mission, and values
Able to provide candid and constructive feedback to team members
Have a bias to take ownership of challenges facing your team and see them through to conclusion
An instinct to ask why to get deeper understanding of problems
Ability to establish trust with your team and invest in building professional relationships
Able to have gap analysis conversations and help team members define effective goals
Ability to inspire and motivate others without needing to micromanage
Strong emotional intelligence and listening skills
A desire to operate in a mentorship capacity, enabling others’ success
Experience leading technical teams and providing quality control at both the macro and micro level.
Participate in recruiting efforts, including crafting job descriptions, interviewing candidates, and evaluating new hires to build a high-performing team
Oversee the onboarding process, ensuring new team members have the resources, training, and support needed to succeed

What's in it for you:
Compensation & Perks

Competitive compensation package
Retirement Savings Matching Program (RRSP)
Access to the latest tech
Partnership with Perkopolis Discounts


Flexibility & Time Off

Remote first work environment
Flexible work hours & location
Paid parental leave options


Health & Wellness

Employer paid health & dental premiums
Partnership with GreenShield+ Counselling Mental Health provider

$500 in Health Care Spending Account annually


Growth & Development

Training reimbursement (e.g courses on Udemy, Coursera, a-cloud-guru etc.)
Peer recognition rewards

Department School of Public Health
Salary range $64,606.98 to $89,418.01
Hours per week 37.5
Grade 10
Posted date March 26, 2025
Closing date April 11, 2025
Position Type Full Time - Trust Funded
Description
This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).
This position has a term length of 1 year plus 1 day and offers a comprehensive benefits package.
Location - This role is in-person at North Campus Edmonton.
Working at the University of Alberta
The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all FirstPeoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.
The University of Alberta is a community of knowledge seekers, change makers and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to over 14,000 faculty and staff, more than 40,000 students and a growing community of 300,000 alumni worldwide.
Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross-section of people — from our students and community members, to our renowned researchers and innovators, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger and more just. Learn more.
Working for the School of Public Health
The School of Public Health at the University of Alberta is a non-departmentalized faculty that is interdisciplinary research, learning, and scholarship in the pursuit of improving the health of communities and populations. The School is made up of several administrative and academic groups, including our centres and research teams. Together, these groups work to fulfill our mission to create knowledge, educate public health professionals, and to advance the public's health. This position is with the Yuan Research Team within the School of Public Health. The Yuan Research Team's work is focused on the areas of biostatistics and epidemiology and aims to develop and apply biostatistics methods in public health and biomedical research, with current projects focusing on the risk prediction and surveillance of cancers in pediatric and adult populations.
Position Summary
The Senior Research Assistant is primarily responsible for leading advanced statistical analysis activities for ongoing research projects. Research activities include performing data extraction and variable derivation, data quality checking and cleaning, data manipulating, conducting descriptive and inferential analyses, developing and applying modern and classical statistical models using administrative, cancer registry and cohort data, interpreting the results, drafting manuscripts, and presenting the findings for administrative and operational decision-making. The role also includes maintaining a brain tumour surveillance website, contribution to additional research and knowledge translation activities as needed, as well as mentoring other researchers and trainees within the team.
The Senior Research Assistant will work closely with the principal investigator, Dr. Yan Yuan, the project manager, and other members of the research team. The Senior Research Assistant position will consist of approximately 80% statistical research activities with up to 20% for miscellaneous research activities (e.g., manuscript writing, liaising with and mentoring project team members, and managing data repositories), recognizing that this breakdown may fluctuate as needs change.
Duties
Conducting advanced statistical analyses on data, including longitudinal analysis, survival analysis, and generalized linear models, and methods related to machine learning
Lead processes related to data requisition, cleaning, storage, analysis, and synthesis from various sources, including linked administrative data and health records, cancer registries, biomarker registries, and other supplemental data sources (I.e., Vital Statistics, Census)
Working with the PI to develop and implement analytical plans for current and future (i.e., grant applications and future funded work) research projects
Working with other researchers to support the development, implementation, and testing of natural language processing cancer detection algorithms
Reviewing and providing feedback on the statistical coding syntax, output, and interpretation of other Research Team members as needed to ensure accuracy and methodological rigour
Providing mentorship for researchers and trainees in the team as needed
Communicating with project stakeholders and data repositories (written and verbal)
Reviewing and providing feedback on the statistical coding syntax, output, and interpretation of other Research Team members as needed to ensure accuracy and methodological rigour
Supporting knowledge translation activities, including helping prepare manuscripts, reports, summaries, and oral presentations
Collaborating on other academic activities and publications
Reviewing and providing feedback on the statistical coding syntax, output, and interpretation of other Research Team members as needed to ensure accuracy and methodological rigour
Exceptional organizational skills and ability to multi-task and address multiple simultaneous priorities in an effective, efficient manner
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including experience presenting and writing for both academic and lay audiences
Minimum Qualifications
Master's degree in statistics or biostatistics
At least one year of work experience in a similar position
Experience independently conducting advanced quantitative data analysis, including working with confidential data, administrative health data and patient records data, and linking data from various data sources
Experience with classical and modern statistical methods, including regression analysis, cross-sectional and longitudinal data analysis, survival analysis, and working knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, STATA, SAS) and coding languages (e.g., SQL, Python)
Experience with quantitative public health research and research methods, including data cleaning and synthesis, research ethics and best practices, epidemiological methods and analyses, data visualization, and contributing to knowledge translation activities
Experience working with senior and junior researchers, government and non-profit organizations, university administration, academic and community stakeholders, database administrators, and health practitioners
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in cancer research preferred
Experience with the peer-review process (e.g., preparation and revision of research manuscripts, manuscript submission to academic journals for publication) preferred
Experience accessing and liaising with data repositories preferred

Job Title: Production Machine Operator - WDP - Red Deer, Alberta
Job Description:
POSITION OVERVIEW
The primary role of the Production Machine Operator is responsible for operating machinery and ensuring the production process runs smoothly and efficiently. They are tasked with monitoring equipment, performing routine inspections and ensuring Safety & Quality standards are maintained during processing.
The Production Machine Operator works in partnership with the other Production Operators and leadership to assist in identifying and improving operational effectiveness and efficiency within production operations. As a key member of the Vitalus Nutrition - WDP, team, participates in department projects and initiatives.
Job Location: Red Deer, Alberta
VALUES: Integrity, Care & Expertise (ICE)
PURPOSE: Improving Lives – By unlocking the Nutritional Value of Milk
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:
Is to ensure day-to-day operations are carried out on schedule, meets daily goals, and produce consistent product quality and to maintain compliance throughout the manufacturing process.
KEY RESPONSIBILITY AREAS:
Production:

Set up, start-up, operator, CIP and shutdown plant equipment, this includes keep their workstation clean and in compliance with Hygiene practices

Trouble shoot equipment & escalate to leadership when resolution is unknown or not achievable and
will affect ability to complete daily targets

Complete required documentation during and at the end of a shift in order to maintain integrity of our
process and to meet Quality Safety Regulations

Package, palletize and move finished product according to customer specifications and organizational
requirements

Ensure production documentation is accurate, complete & submitted within defined timelines to ensure
 inventory records are correct and up-to-date.
Quality Control:

Maintains product quality by practicing, complying with and enforcing GMP, Quality & Food Safety, HACCP
and ISO requirements throughout the entire production lifecycle

Follows specifications and standard operational procedures (SOP's) at all times, to achieve product quality

Performs required product testing and records test results, in accordance with SOP's

Participates in the implementation of corrective action for product problems and process deficiencies

Acts with a sense of urgency by communicating and escalating any deviation in our standard practices to
leadership to mitigate loss of product or negative impact to quality
Health & Safety:

Adheres to all Health & Safety policies, practices and protocols set out by the Company and those related to
 job responsibilities and tasks

This includes wearing all required PPE as defined in our policies & SOP's relating to the handling of chemicals
 and high-risk activities
Continuous Improvement:

Assists leadership by participating in continuous improvement initiatives

Contributes insights and ideas to improve the efficiency of our operations
COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills, Ability)
Sound working knowledge of and adherence to HACCP requirements and standard operating procedures.
Ability to perform under ISO 17025 standards for quality.
Effectively collaborates with others to achieve area and team goals.
Time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks within a fast-paced environment.
Follows process and quality procedures maintaining adequate, accurate and timely documentation
Evaluate routine problems, make rational recommendations, and implement solutions.
Participate in required meetings, safety discussions, and committees providing input and recommendations.
Deal with changes, delays, or unexpected events in a calm and timely manner.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
High school diploma
One year experience in a manufacturing environment related to food or a similar industry, would be an asset
Experience with HACCP or other quality systems would be an asset.
Experience in operating manual and power pallet jacks and forklifts.
Mechanical aptitude.
Fluent English (verbal and written communication skills) with the ability to follow and give clear instructions.
Highly detail oriented.
Able to lift 25 kg (55 lbs.)
Capability to work independently without constant supervision.
Basic proficiency in MS Word, MS Outlook, and spreadsheet/database (MS Excel).
BENEFITS

Competitive Hourly Rate
Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D, LTD & Life Insurance Benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Time Off
Learning opportunities
Bonus Program
RRSP/DPSP Program
Social & Wellness Events
Attendance Incentive
Shift Premiums for non-standard hours & weekends
COMPANY INFORMATION
Vitalus Nutrition’s purpose is, “Improving lives by unlocking the nutritional value of milk” and one way we do that is by taking high-quality Canadian milk, isolating the valuable components, and transforming them into specialized ingredients for the nutritional and industrial markets. We are a trusted international supplier of specialty ingredients including Milk Protein Concentrates, Milk Protein Isolates, and VITAGOS™ for large-scale processors and top tier brands.
Bringing Milk to Life™
Our team is proud of what we do and the contributions we make in both our local and global communities. Our culture is deeply rooted in our values of Integrity, Care, and Expertise.

Description
The Deployment Specialist II will act as a mid-level escalation point within the Deployment Services team for Service Desk or Deployment Specialist I require higher level technical or deployment related expertise and input. This may include but is not limited to the running of diagnostic programs, determining and implementing solutions within the Deployment Services Scope of Support as well as mentoring and assisting others on the team. A Deployment Specialist II will also take part in large scale workstation imaging, configurations, and deployments at client sites. They will also be the main escalation point from the service desk for any workstation hardware issues and process warranty claims. The Deployment Specialist ll will perform base configuration of network equipment such as network switches, access points and firewalls along with other hardware that the project team deploys.

They will also be responsible for completing all related tasks associated with the Deployment Specialist I role along with coordinating vendors for warranty and repair claims and the added responsibility of achieving and maintaining certification as a Lenovo Certified Repair Technician (based on need).

About VC3
VC3 offers Managed IT Services, Private Cloud Services, Hosted VoIP, Custom Web Applications, SharePoint Consulting, and Website Design & Hosting.

VC3 has more than 25 years of experience providing a full range of Information Technology Solutions and Services to hundreds of municipalities and organizations throughout the United States and Canada. The technologies needed by our customers have changed many times over the years, but our focus has always stayed the same: connect the best technologies with our experienced and talented engineers, programmers, web designers and support specialists to deliver solutions that take our customers to the next level of productivity and results.

We pride ourselves on making IT personal, making IT easy, and getting IT right. And it all starts with our talented team that is committed to raising the bar.

ABOUT HELCIM
Helcim was founded with a mission at heart: to be the world’s most loved payment system. We believe that by offering small businesses in North America a decidedly human payment solution where it is easier to sign up and use while being transparent and affordable, we can empower them to grow and prosper. Simply put, helping small businesses thrive is at the very core of our business model, and we think that’s a great way to do business.
From the very start, we knew that we wanted to be different from every payment processor out there. We want the merchants we serve to feel supported and see us as a trusted partner rather than simply just another “cost of doing business.” We are relentless in our pursuit to provide a radically transparent and honest payments solution that flat out saves business owners money, all while treating them like human beings.
THE POSITION
We are searching for an experienced and passionate professional to take on the role of Data Platform Manager. Leading a talented team of Data Platform Developers (aka data engineers ;)), you will be responsible for the infrastructure and pipelines to deliver data to our risk management systems, data warehouse, self service analytics, and support ML Ops. This role demands a strong technical background, proven leadership skills, and a customer-centric approach to delivering high-quality data solutions.
As a technical leader and strategic partner, you will have ownership over the direction of the data platform, defining roadmaps while maintaining a focus on system scalability, performance, and quality. The data platform plays a critical role throughout Helcim that impacts the experience of our merchants.
HERE ARE THE THINGS YOU’LL OWN DAY TO DAY


Manage and lead a team of data platform developers responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure
Prioritize and continuously develop the roadmap for the data platform aligned with the business direction and other stakeholders
Lead the design, development, and maintenance of ELT and real time data pipelines and infrastructure
Build and maintain data warehousing and storage solutions to support our data analytics and reporting needs
Establish and maintain robust monitoring and alerting systems for data pipelines, infrastructure, and deployed machine learning models (MLOps)
Oversee the implementation of governance and related initiatives to maintain the trusted integrity of our data
Drive the development of a self-service data platform that empowers teams to access and utilize gold-standard data
Ensure the timely resolution of data-related issues and incidents

A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE

5+ years of experience in data engineering, with at least 2+ years in a management or leadership role
Experienced data professional with a proven track record of leading teams that balance business delivery with operational excellence of technical solutions
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Strong understanding of analytics engineering development cycles, including data modeling, version control, documentation, and best practices for codebase development
Strong understanding of data warehousing, ETL/ELT processes, and data governance principles
Experience with the programming languages of our analytics stack (SQL, Python) or other related languages
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, prioritizing iterative technical solutions to solve complex problems.
Experiences with the following or similar tech in our stack will be assets in this role:
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and and their BigQuery Data Warehouse
Data orchestration technologies such as Dagster or Airflow
Data transformation technologies such as dbt
Containerization platforms such as Docker or Kubernetes
Kafka or other data streaming platforms
Observability platforms such as DataDog
Linux operating systems, including performing command-line tasks, system administration, and troubleshooting
Metabase or other business intelligence applications

HELCIM CULTURE IS;

Being builders: We build things ourselves and we build them well. We use technology and our creativity to overcome challenges that would seem beyond the capability of a company our size. We improve what is already there, invent our way out of problems and we never stop dreaming of better.
Choosing the harder path: We believe that the right decisions are usually the harder ones, so we embrace the challenge and endure when others quit. We choose what is difficult because it is more rewarding in the long-term, and makes us resilient, so that we not only survive but thrive.

Creating trust: We earn trust by striving to be our best selves every day and by lifting those around us. We recognize that trust is hard to earn, easy to lose and is tested continuously over time, so we make trust our way of life.

Contributing to a company of many: We are stronger because of our collective passion, diversity, and fellowship. We believe only great teams can accomplish great things, and we ask the very best of each other. Together we create our own future.

WORKING AT HELCIM

Joining Helcim means joining a fast-growing company where we have found coming together makes us a strong company. We have a drive to achieve big things which creates amazing opportunities for everyone willing to work hard and contribute to that growth - opportunities for faster career growth, for more learning, more impact, and accelerated experience - all while surrounding yourself with incredible people working on interesting problems and delivering great results.
Here are some of the reasons we attract such great people:
The Way of the Helcim: At Helcim, we build a team of engaged, caring and intelligent people. In return we provide an environment where you can be excited to come to work each day and tackle these challenges with an amazing team. Learn more about Helcim’s unique culture and environment in our culture book The Way of the Helcim.
Health and dental benefits: Through our Group Benefits, you’ll get access to dental benefits, extended healthcare benefits for drugs, vision, paramedical coverage (e.g. massage therapists, dieticians, mental health professionals), counseling, health service navigation, life insurance, critical illness and disability insurance, and more. All of these benefits come into effect on Day 1 of employment!

Dedicated Health Spending Account (“HSA”): An additional budget available for you to spend on health-related expenses (e.g. eyeglasses, therapy).

Maternity and Parental Leave: To help launch our team members into this phase of family life we have some additional benefits in place including salary top for the birthing parents and a bonding break for non-birthing parents.
Stock Options: Stock options enable our team to purchase Helcim shares at a future date at a specified price. Every team member, not just people leaders and executives receive equity (aka ownership in the company).

Vacation Time: All team members get paid vacation time and a company break in December so they can recharge when they need it.
Flexible work location: Work and life happens at different times and places. This is why our team enjoys the flexibility of hybrid work and flexibility around hours of work, so we can all do our best work. Our hybrid work schedule offers flexibility to work from home on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Furthermore, our core hours give team members flexibility to manage other parts of their lives.
Training: Helcim will cover 50% of the applicable training costs of up to $500 per year.

As Vice President, Software Engineering, you will play a crucial role in driving the company’s strategic vision while ensuring rapid execution. You will lead multiple teams, fostering both people and technical leadership within those teams, while also acting as a key partner to the Product team to align technical execution with business goals. Your ability to balance short-term quick wins with long-term scalable solutions will be essential to success.
This role demands technical depth, strategic foresight, strong project execution skills, and a passion for building high-performing teams. You will be responsible for ensuring best practices are in place, reducing single points of failure by proactively identifying gaps, promoting documentation, and enforcing command and control through autonomy within clear guidelines. A key requirement for this role is proven experience driving AI tools in a software development setting, with exposure to building Machine Learning and AI-backed product features. This is a focal area for the successful candidate, ensuring our AI initiatives align with business objectives and deliver impactful, scalable solutions.
Beyond direct team leadership, you will collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to drive cross-functional initiatives that improve efficiency, scalability, and execution speed. Your experience leading in a fast-paced, early-stage SaaS environment will be instrumental in navigating the challenges and opportunities that come with rapid growth.
Duties and Responsibilities include:
Serve as a key partner to the Product team, ensuring seamless collaboration between Engineering and Product to drive strategy and execution of the road map.
Develop and execute a strategic vision that aligns engineering efforts with overall business objectives, balancing speed with long-term sustainability.
Assess and implement best in class AI -backed software development to ensure our AI initiatives align with business objectives to deliver impactful, scalable solutions.
Identify and reduce single points of failure by proactively looking under the hood, enforcing documentation, and implementing robust processes to ensure resiliency.
Establish a culture of command and control—allowing autonomy within clearly defined guidelines to enable efficiency and consistency across teams.
Guide the team in delivering streamlined solutions by leveraging expertise in program management, cost management, people management, risk management, change management, Agile software development, and scalable system planning.
Build and maintain high-performing teams that deliver reliable, scalable, and sustainable solutions while ensuring a predictable output.
Maintain vendor relationships to stay ahead of industry changes, capitalize on opportunities, and optimize cost-value equations.
Oversee the entire software development lifecycle, ensuring best practices in system design, development, quality, security, privacy, and operations.
Establish and enforce best practices across major systems, services, technologies, and architecture to drive efficiency and scalability.
Partner with other engineering leaders to identify roadblocks, skill gaps, and opportunities to enhance developer satisfaction and effectiveness.
Implement key metrics to track team performance, service health, and overall engineering effectiveness, reporting these on a regular basis.
Act as a bridge between teams, senior leadership, and executive leadership, ensuring clear and effective communication at all levels.
Provide hands-on leadership to geographically dispersed teams, conducting regular 1:1s, workload balancing, team meetings, and performance coaching to foster individual and team growth.
Play a key role in workforce planning, hiring, onboarding, performance management, and, when necessary, managing employee exits.
Qualifications and Experience:
BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science, or relevant field, OR demonstrable experience commensurate with the education requirement
15+ years of experience in the software engineering leadership
 Strong experience leading engineering teams in early-stage, high-growth managed services tech companies.
Proven experience driving AI tools in a software development setting, with exposure to building Machine Learning and AI-backed product features. This is a key requirement and focal area for this role.
A track record of fostering a culture of speed, execution, and strategic alignment with Product teams.
Strong leadership experience, including coaching and performance management.
Exceptional problem-solving skills with a focus on scalable, sustainable solutions.
Strong ability to communicate technical concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Deep experience with Agile development methodologies and best practices.
Key Competencies:
Strong strategic vision with the ability to execute and scale at speed.
Ability to identify and mitigate single points of failure through proactive documentation and best practices.
Leadership skills that balance autonomy with clear guidelines to drive efficiency and alignment.
Strong analytical and decision-making skills to navigate technical and business challenges.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly.
Deep understanding of agile methodologies and scalable system architectures.
Proven experience in cross-functional collaboration, particularly with Product teams, to drive business outcomes.
Key Performance Indicators:
Alignment of engineering initiatives with product and business objectives.
Delivery of high-quality, scalable solutions with A focus on executing with speed and velocity.
Reduction of single points of failure and improved documentation practices.
Team performance, engagement, and retention.
Clear and consistent communication between engineering, product, and senior leadership.

About the Role
We’re Hiring for a Sr. Data Engineer in Calgary, AB. This role is hybrid - in-office with 20% flexibility to work from home.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a key role in architecting and optimizing a modern, scalable, and productized data ecosystem that enables internal teams and external partners to derive maximum value from our data assets. You will work on designing high-performance data pipelines, storage solutions, and API-driven data access mechanisms that support real-time decision-making and innovation.

The ideal candidate has 5+ years of experience in data engineering, with modern data storage and processing, proficiency in ETL frameworks and event-driven architectures. They will also have strong API development skills and proficiency in Go, Java and/or Python. They will be a collaborative team player with a passion for innovation and mentoring other team members to increase overall team proficiency in data.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Data Architecture & Engineering
Design and build a scalable, cloud-native data platform aligned with microservices.
Develop real-time and batch data pipelines to power data-driven products.
Implement SQL, NoSQL, and hybrid storage strategies for diverse business needs.

Data as a Product
Enable self-serve data access with secure, well-documented data APIs.
Collaborate with Product & Business teams to define and optimize data products.
Ensure data quality, lineage, and governance in all data pipelines and products.

Microservices Integration & Performance
Build event-driven architectures using Kafka, Azure Event Hub, or Service Bus.
Develop scalable ETL/ELT processes for ingestion, transformation, and distribution.
Optimize query performance, indexing, and caching for data-intensive apps.

Data Governance, Security, and Compliance
Enforce data privacy, security, and access controls aligned with compliance standards.
Implement observability and monitoring for data infrastructure and pipelines.
Work with DevSecOps teams to integrate security into CI/CD workflows

Qualifications:
Must Haves
5+ years of experience in data engineering, with exposure to Data Mesh and Data as a Product preferred.
Expertise in modern data storage and processing, including SQL, NoSQL (Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL), Data Lakes (Azure Data Lake, Delta Lake, Apache Iceberg).
Proficiency in ETL frameworks (e.g. Apache Kafka, Airflow, Flink, Spark, Azure Data Factory, Databricks).
Experience with Event-driven architectures using Queues, Pub/Sub services (e.g. Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid, Amazon Event Bridge) and Containerized Environments (Container Apps, AWS ECS).
Experience with Apache and/or Azure data platforms or similar, e.g. Fabric, Databricks, Snowflake, and Apache Hudi.
Strong API development skills using GraphQL, REST, and/or gRPC for enabling data as a product.
Proficiency in Go, Java, and/or Python.
Deep understanding of data governance, security, lineage, and compliance using Microsoft Purview, OpenLineage, Apache Ranger, or Azure Key Vault.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep, Terraform, or CloudFormation for managing cloud-based data solutions.
Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills, working across data, engineering, and business teams.

Nice to Have
Knowledge of ML, AI, and LLMs, including data engineering for model training and inference with Azure Machine Learning, Databricks ML, and MLflow.
Hands-on experience in Notebooks (e.g. Jupyter, Databricks, Azure Synapse) for data workflows.
Experience in real-time data streaming architectures.
Exposure to data monetization strategies and analytics frameworks.
Familiarity with federated data governance and self-serve data platforms.

Job Title: Member of Technical Staff - Software Development
Job Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences - the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world's most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

THE ROLE:
As a Software Development Engineer and Member of Technical Staff, you will provide technical leadership and strategic support across the AMD Radeon Open Ecosystem (ROCm) ecosystem. You will work collaboratively as a part of a core libraries engineering team building and maintaining artificial intelligence and machine learning libraries. You will work cross-functionally with a team of talented computer scientists, software developers, and applied mathematicians and facilitate the delivery of features on our product roadmaps.

THE PERSON:
To be successful in this role, you will be a hands-on software development engineer with strong technical skills and demonstrated success in shipping software in an Agile environment. You are passionate about leading through demonstration of technical excellence and managing key engineering initiatives. You are a strong communicator and can convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work collaboratively across library teams to design, implement, validate, and deliver key software library capabilities, ensuring successful integration with GPU kernels into broader systems.
Provide input to architecture, design, and documentation efforts as they arise across teams - Work closely with senior developers, architects, and stakeholders to maintain a long-term strategy and coordinate with subject matter experts in GPU technologies. Provide guidance and mentorship across integrated libraries and engineering teams on complex technical challenges.
Collaborate with principal members of staff to develop the best technical designs and approaches that holistically consider constraints, performance, and roadmap commitments. Self-manage, execute, and report progress against project plans and delivery commitments.
Demonstrate technical and team leadership by proactively identifying gaps and developing plans to remediate in collaboration with library owners and engineering principal colleagues.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Extensive and hands-on experience with C++, with relevant applied experience using CUDA, HIP, OpenMP, MPI, or OpenCL for accelerated computing on CPUs and GPUs.
Experience with and demonstrated contributions employing continuous improvement of the software lifecycle, including build robustness, regression and performance management, software deployment and orchestration management (Docker/Kubernetes) and various methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, Kanban.
Experience with open-source software development including collaboration with community maintainers and submitting contributions.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development life cycle including requirements elicitation and analysis, scoping/estimation, coding standards, code reviews, version control, build processes, testing, and continuous integration.
Experience working in the day-to-day activities of an engineering team using Agile methods.
Knowledge of AI/ML Frameworks, Operators, Patterns, and Architectures. Familiarity with applied use of TensorFlow, PyTorch, and JAX.
Familiarity with numerical methods and applications in technical and high performance computing.

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta

Implementation of use cases using SPL/KQL with complex correlation across different data sources

Experience in various security tools (e.g. SIEM, EDR, etc.) as well as operating system flavors including but not limited to Windows, Linux, Unix
Prior experience in SIEM implementation or operations for solutions like Azure Sentinel, Chronicle, Splunk, ArcSight Tools
Experience on KQL/SPL
Basic knowledge of User Entity Behavior, Machine Learning models
Scripting knowledge of python is an added advantage

Experience of threat intelligence and threat hunting is added advantage
Proficient communication, analytical skills, problem solving and interpersonal skills
Knowledge of security applications, operations systems, network devices, databases, middleware to address security threats
Proficient in preparation of documentation
Demonstrated ability to produce quality and consistency in delivery with own, and team(s) work
Demonstrated ability to be transparent and accountable at all levels
Azure Certification (AZ 500- Microsoft Azure Security Engineer Associate, SC 200 - Microsoft Security Operations Analyst), Sec +, Network+, CISM, CISSP and GIAC certifications preferred
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives

We’re committed to providing accommodations throughout the application, interview, and employment process. If you require an accommodation to be at your best, please let us know during the application process.

Energy companies rely upon ESG solutions to grow revenue, increase efficiency, and facilitate business innovation. ESG provides the broadest energy sector market and meter data management to deliver an energy transition platform that optimizes the customer-to-cash process for utilities, pipeline and storage, and retail energy providers. The company provides a full suite of financial, land, and field solutions that enable oil and gas producers, pipelines, renewables, and utilities companies to efficiently track and manage their business operations with less staff. Across sectors, ESG automates complex, time-consuming processes with an integrated suite of tools to reduce the cost to serve and increase efficiency through data and insights to get results that matter. ESG is ISO9001/27001-certified in the United Kingdom and SOC 2 in North America. We put the power of data in your hands. ESG is backed by Accel-KKR, a global software-focused private equity firm with $19 billion in cumulative capital commitments. Visit www.esgglobal.com to learn more.
ESG is seeking exceptional Software Developers for our Calgary, Alberta Hub to help deliver the next generation of retail energy solutions in our North American Markets. The right candidate will pair a strong foundation of software development skills with the ability to find practical and effective solutions to match our product vision.
Your responsibilities will include:
Design and Develop Software Services: Architect, design, and implement scalable, reliable, and secure software solutions in Java. Contribute to and lead the development of microservices and APIs that manage and process energy market data, provide a platform for analytics and machine learning, and integrate with a wide variety of internal and external partner systems.
Cloud Infrastructure: Develop and deploy cloud-based services using platforms like AWS, Kubernetes (K8s), and Docker. Ensure that applications are optimized for cloud environments, including high availability and fast release cycles.
Data Management: Design and implement data storage solutions, focusing on scalability, performance, and reliability. Work with databases and data streaming platforms to handle large volumes of energy market data efficiently..
Code Quality and Best Practices Contribute to the development of search engine marketing, SEO, and PPC strategies for the region.
Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, product delivery teams, and other engineers to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet the goals of our clients.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies. Proactively suggest improvements to existing systems and processes to enhance efficiency and scalability
Requirements
Essential:
 Able to demonstrate ESGs key values of
 Excellence: be accountable to deliver our best.
 Passion: show how much we care each day.
 Integrity: do the right thing when no one is looking.
 Collaboration: work together to succeed together.
3-5 years software development experience with enterprise or large-scale software services and applications, with emphasis on cloud platforms and SAAS implementations.
Strong Java development skills and experience in Spring Boot, event driven architecture, and API development.
Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
Proficiency in JavaScript/HTML/CSS, and familiarity with front end frameworks such as React or Vue.
Strong object-oriented design skills and knowledge of design patterns.
Comfortable working collaboratively on large code bases and contribute to peer code review.
Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL), data modeling, and data streaming technologies.
Experience with unit testing, continuous integration and deployment methodologies, code instrumentation techniques, code quality metrics.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
Excellent communication with proficiency in both synchronous (meetings, video calls) and asynchronous (email, documentation, chat) communication methods.
Desirable:
Experience with Energy Market systems, payment processing, or financial transaction systems.
Benefits
What's in it for you?
Flexible choose to work from home or office work environment
Flexible hours
Competitive benefits package (100% dental reimbursement)
Training budget & Programs
Fully stocked kitchen (tons of free food, if you choose to work at the office)
Games room & lounge area
Virtual & in-person social activities/learning events
Shared community cards
Wellness Budget
